name: elementally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very basic, simple, and powerful: The story is both elementally Russian and universally understandable. There's something elementally thrilling about seeing that much passionate male energy on a stage.
in a way that relates to the basic elements (= earth, air, fire, and water) or the basic power of nature: The characters feel that some inhuman, irresistible force - elementally represented by the waterfall - has seized them. They named their children elementally: River, Summer, Rain and Leaf.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is something elementally satisfying about the roll of the dice and the click-clack of little wooden counters.Fidelio is surely the most elementally moving of all operas.There are myriad characters like this in fiction - elementally unlikable, yet important character studies.The image of lightning touched me elementally and held me transfixed.The crystal-clear water felt so elementally and deliciously warm it was like surrendering to an embrace.
